title: Education and Training: The Learner-Centered Classroom
subject: CTE (2022-)

document.title: CAREER AND TECHNICAL EDUCATION PROGRAM OF STUDIES HIGH SCHOOL 2021 - 2022

482079A4C62940F7B976BA0126A5A925.description:
High Leverage Practices: eliciting and interpreting individual students’ thinking,
coordinating and adjusting instruction during a lesson, interpreting the results of
student work, including routine assignments, quizzes, tests, projects, and
standardized assessments, analyzing instruction for the purpose of improving it,
setting short- and long-term learning goals for students, checking student
understanding during and at the conclusion of lessons, selecting and designing
formal assessments of student learning

E8C4DB01A5034B95832F52D8E3BFD1D0.description:
Classroom Management: student engagement, culturally relevant teaching,
classroom norms and routines, inclusive learning environments, anti-bullying
strategies, de-escalating and managing conflict.

A933A87487FA46D9955079B88D1FA2DF.description:
Know different classroom managements and instructional strategies, understand the
purpose and results of a strategy, and practice selecting, implementing and reflecting on a
variety of classroom strategies and how these strategies meet the needs of diverse
learners.

DCD8B69C159E42C5AFD5B25248DA4526.description:
Engaging with Students: motivation, challenging all students and meeting all
students’ needs, brain-based learning, personalized learning, and deeper learning.

C43AD3DF5187452D8D6B3BDB1CE88ED1.description:
Students know about different learning needs, understand that students’
experiences are unique and practice planning for, responding to and reflecting on
how to meet the needs of diverse students. (Special Education 101,
differentiation, types of disabilities in IDEA (Individuals with Disabilities Education Act), supporting students facing trauma)

F947036075A9428E93286992FCBCF420.description:
Students understand factors that impact relationships with students and practice
planning for, developing and reflecting on how they relate to students by
considering cultural competence, expectations for students, building mutual
respect, establishing boundaries, embracing diversity, asset-based approach, and
celebrating success.

E77C757762F14A3E9784878862828490.description:
Students know the cognitive development: ages and stages, experiential learning,
constructivism.

B3E22044CF924712A9CA634DCBBFEE80.description: Know, practice and reflect on how teachers understand their students.

40A613F5F7174620A31B573CA3C04EFB.description:
Critical Thinking: responsive planning, critical thinking: my experiences, how
do I know if I learned something? media literacy, resource literacy, investigating
sources.

08DC68527E8A4082A47DB811879DD909.description: Improvement: growth mindset, reflective habits of mind.

A260EC30EAC44F57B368BC7E4F960A66.description:
Personal Expectations: professionalism, becoming a change agent, high personal
standards, responsible use of social media and online platforms, accountable talk
including meaningful praise. Students review these topics as expectations for
entering classrooms.

E79CB0B1BBC84C728BF6A533D4DD2D03.description:
Know, practice and reflect on concepts relating to the personal characteristics of
education professionals
